text: Does anyone have, or are aware of, requirements for deriving insights from a blockchain using analytics techniques? Clearly the technology has capabilities that are designed to _prevent_ other parties from deriving too much insight about the actors in blockchain transactions but strikes me that being able to mine information that is willingly given on the chain would be useful too.

<@U1TARSPGT>: querying the blockchain has come up as a general requirement in several use cases that were discussed. <@U12KFP7JN> noted in today's requirements WG call the need to map fabric keys to off-chain secondary lookup attributes for indexing purposes. Forensic blockchain analysis and visualization from companies like Elliptic or <http://BitIodine.net|BitIodine.net> may be worth a look.

<@U14KZA474>: query current state table in a blockchain network or query TXs of older blocks? Blocks will get long and big in days and may need to be archived in a matter of days in production <@U12KFP7JN> <@U0W7D64LC>
The reference keys can be "live" in the current state table too
